author: sky.cactus
content: That sentiment seems to be the consensus.  I think the general thinking is that we have this giant state database, why not use it instead of the header when we want to add new things.

author: sky.cactus
content: Essentially, we shouldn't use the header for state data "just because we always have", we should use the header when it makes sense to be in the header for some reason.

author: sky.cactus
content: One potential reason is because block header data has different availability guarantees compared to state, and it is accessible in different ways.
